title: Snowboarding
short_description: Ride a single board down snow-covered mountains for a freestyle thrill.
long_description:
Snowboarding is the 'cool' younger sibling of skiing, inspired by surfing and skateboarding. Instead of two skis and poles, you are strapped sideways onto a single board. This setup makes it trickier to learn balance initially, but immensely rewarding once mastered, as the sensation creates a fluid 'surfing' motion on snow.

Gulmarg and Sethan (Hamta Valley) are the snowboarding capitals of India. The deep powder in Gulmarg is particularly suited for snowboarding as the wide board floats better than thin skis. A growing community of local snowboarders and instructors makes it accessible for beginners to learn.

locations.summary: Igloo village with great backcountry slopes.
Beginner slopes with plenty of rental shops.

operating_season.season_notes: Sethan season is shorter than Gulmarg.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Snowboarding gear is slightly harder to find in Auli than Gulmarg.

safety_guidelines: Wrist guards are highly recommended (common injury for beginners).
padded shorts (a.k.a. 'bum pads') help with the many fails on your backside.
Always look uphill before merging trails.
Watch out for skiers; your blind spot is larger.
Secure your board with a leash.

sample_itinerary.one_day: Sethan: 10 AM Hike to slope. 10:30 AM Strap in. Practice toe-side and heel-side edges. 1 PM Maggi lunch in an Igloo. 2 PM Free riding.

booking_details.suggested_stay: Stay in Sethan for igloo experience; Gulmarg for luxury.
booking_details.how_to_reach: Sethan is 45 mins from Manali (4x4 required).
